program codeforces_37a

implicit none

integer :: n, i

integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: arr

integer :: current_val, current_count, max_freq = 0, unique = 0

!

unique =0

max_freq =0

! Loop from 2 to n:

do i=2, n

    if ( arr(i) == arr(i-1) ) then

        current_count = current_count +1 

    else 

        ! End of previous group. if ( current_count > max_freq ) then

            max_freq = current_count

        end if

        unique = unique +1 

        current_val=arr(i) current_count =1 

    end if 

end do 

! process the last group 

unique = unique + 1 

if ( current_count > max_freq ) then 

   max_freq = current_count 

end if 

!

children.text:
Implementing quicksort in Fortran:

I can write a recursive function to sort the array between indices. Here's an outline for the Quicksort routine:

recursive subroutine qsort( a, first, last )

    implicit none

    integer, intent(inout) :: a(:)

    integer, intent(in) :: first, last

    integer :: pivot, i, j, temp

    if( first >= last ) return

    pivot = a( (first+last)/2 )

    i=first

    j =last

    do

        do while( a(i) < pivot ) i = i +1 

        end do 

        do while( a(j) > pivot )

            j = j -1 

        end do 

        if (i <=j ) then 

            temp = a(i)

            a(i) = a(j)

            a(j) = temp 

            i = i +1 

            j = j -1 

        else 

            exit 

        end if 

    end do 

    call qsort( a, first, j )
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text:
call qsort( a, i, last )

end subroutine qsort

Then, in the main program, the sort is called with:

call qsort(arr, 1, n) Thus this would work.
children.label: mental_execution

children.text:
Okay, putting it all together:

So the Fortran code:

program codeforces_37a

    implicit none

    integer :: n, i

    integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: arr

    integer :: current_val, current_count, max_freq, unique

    read *, n 

    allocate( arr(n) )

    read *, arr 

    call qsort(arr, 1, n)  ! Assuming qsort is declared

    if (n ==0 ) then 

        print *, 0 0 

        stop 

    end if 

    current_val = arr(1)

    current_count =1 

    max_freq =0 

    unique =0 

    do i=2, n 

        if ( arr(i) == arr(i-1) ) then 

            current_count = current_count +1 

        else 

            if( current_count > max_freq ) then 

                max_freq = current_count 

            end if 

            unique = unique +1 

            current_val = arr(i)

            current_count =1 

        end if 

    end do 

    unique = unique +1 

    if ( current_count > max_freq ) then 

        max_freq = current_count 

    end if 

    print '(i0,i0)', max_freq, unique 

contains 

    recursive subroutine qsort( a, first, last )

        implicit none

        integer, intent(inout) :: a(:)

        integer, intent(in) :: first, last 

        integer :: pivot, i_temp, j_temp, temp 

        if( first >= last ) return 

        pivot = a( (first + last)/2 ) i_temp = first 

        j_temp = last 

        do 

            do while ( a(i_temp) < pivot )

                i_temp = i_temp +1 

            end do 

            do while ( a(j_temp) > pivot )

                j_temp = j_temp -1 

            end do 

            if( i_temp <= j_temp ) then 

                temp = a(i_temp)

                a(i_temp) = a(j_temp)

                a(j_temp) = temp 

                i_temp = i_temp +1 

                j_temp = j_temp
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
-1 

            else 

                exit 

            end if 

        end do 

        call qsort(a, first, j_temp )
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
call qsort(a, i_temp, last )

    end subroutine qsort 

end program codeforces_37a

program codeforces_37a

implicit none

integer :: n, i

integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: arr

integer :: current_val, current_count, max_freq = 0, unique = 0

! Read n:

read *, n

! Read the array:

call quicksort( arr, 1, n ) ! Need to implement sorting.

current_count = 1

unique =0

max_freq =0

do i=2, n

    if ( arr(i) == arr(i-1) ) then

        current_count = current_count +1 

    else 

        ! End of previous group.

        if ( current_count > max_freq ) then

            max_freq = current_count

        end if

        unique = unique +1 

        current_val=arr(i)

        current_count =1 

    end if 

end do 

! process the last group 

unique = unique + 1 

if ( current_count > max_freq ) then 

   max_freq = current_count 

end if 

! Now, output:

print *, max_freq, unique ! no, Need to concatenate.

Let's proceed to write a Quicksort.

Implementing quicksort in Fortran:

I can write a recursive function to sort the array between indices. 

Here's an outline for the Quicksort routine:

recursive subroutine qsort( a, first, last )

    implicit none

    integer, intent(inout) :: a(:)

    integer, intent(in) :: first, last

    integer :: pivot, i, j, temp

    if( first >= last ) return

    pivot = a( (first+last)/2 )

    i=first

    j=last

    do

        do while( a(i) < pivot )

            i = i +1 

        end do 

        do while( a(j) > pivot )

            j = j -1 

        end do 

        if (i <=j ) then 

            temp = a(i)

            a(i) = a(j)

            a(j) = temp 

            i = i +1 

            j = j -1 

        else 

            exit 

        end if 

    end do 

    call qsort( a, first, j )

    call qsort( a, i, last )

end subroutine qsort

Then, in the main program, the sort is called with:

call qsort(arr, 1, n)

Thus this would work.

Okay, putting it all together:

So the Fortran code:

program codeforces_37a

    implicit none

    integer :: n, i

    integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: arr

    integer :: current_val, current_count, max_freq, unique

    read *, n 

    allocate( arr(n) )

    read *, arr 

    call qsort(arr, 1, n)  ! Assuming qsort is declared

    if (n ==0 ) then 

        print *, 0 0 

        stop 

    end if 

    current_val = arr(1)

    current_count =1 

    max_freq =0 

    unique =0 

    do i=2, n 

        if ( arr(i) == arr(i-1) ) then 

            current_count = current_count +1 

        else 

            if( current_count > max_freq ) then 

                max_freq = current_count 

            end if 

            unique = unique +1 

            current_val = arr(i)

            current_count =1 

        end if 

    end do 

    unique = unique +1 

    if ( current_count > max_freq ) then 

        max_freq = current_count 

    end if 

    print '(i0,i0)', max_freq, unique 

contains 

    recursive subroutine qsort( a, first, last )

        implicit none

        integer, intent(inout) :: a(:)

        integer, intent(in) :: first, last 

        integer :: pivot, i_temp, j_temp, temp 

        if( first >= last ) return 

        pivot = a( (first + last)/2 )

        i_temp = first 

        j_temp = last 

        do 

            do while ( a(i_temp) < pivot )

                i_temp = i_temp +1 

            end do 

            do while ( a(j_temp) > pivot )

                j_temp = j_temp -1 

            end do 

            if( i_temp <= j_temp ) then 

                temp = a(i_temp)

                a(i_temp) = a(j_temp)

                a(j_temp) = temp 

                i_temp = i_temp +1 

                j_temp = j_temp -1 

            else 

                exit 

            end if 

        end do 

        call qsort(a, first, j_temp )

        call qsort(a, i_temp, last )

    end subroutine qsort 

end program codeforces_37a
